title: After impressing on Quest, The Room studio's spooky, 80s-set VR adventure Ghost Town hits PC very soon
description: Ghost Town - the spooky, 80s-set VR puzzle-adventure from the studio behind the acclaimed The Room series - is a genuine treat, and one that's poised to shake off its former Meta Quest exclusivity very soon. Developer Fireproof Games has announced Ghost Town's paranormal delights will be available on PC via Steam VR from next Tuesday, 15th July. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Acclaimed colony sim RimWorld lifts off for a life in orbit as new Odyssey expansion arrives
description: RimWorld is boldly going where no acclaimed sci-fi colony sim with a weird cannibalism obsession has gone before: up a bit. RimWorld is leaving the ground behind and heading into space for the first time in its new paid Odyssey expansion, which launches today on PC. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Superman 4K Blu-Ray Steelbook Edition Is Up For Preorder At Amazon
description: Superman Limited Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray) $38 Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Walmart Superman Standard Editions $30 for 4K | $25 for Blu-ray | $21 for DVD Preorder 4K Preorder Blu-ray Preorder DVD The new James Gunn-directed Superman movie only just started its theatrical run this week, but preorders are already live for its upcoming Blu-ray release, including a 4K Steelbook Edition that's available for $38. There's also a standard 4K and regular Blu-ray version available available to preorder as well. While there's no release date yet, Blu-rays tend to launch about three months after a film's theatrical run, so we expect these to launch in Fall. That said, preordering the Superman 4K Steelbook or standard edition Blu-rays now means you won't be charged until your order ships, and if the price changes between now and then, you'll only pay the lowest amount. Superman Limited Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray) $38 A release date hasn't been confirmed yet, but we expect this will be out three months after the theatrical run, with October looking likely for the launch of this Blu-ray. The steelbook cover is an an attention-grabber, as it features the entrance to Superman's Fortress of Solitude secret base on the cover, and on the inside, you'll spot the Man of Steel walking through this crystalline ode to his lost homeworld. Bonus materials haven't been revealed yet for this release, but films based on DC Comics generally have a solid assortment of behind-the-scenes featurettes that do a great job at exploring their respective movies. The 2022 release of The Batman is a prime example of this approach--as it is loaded with all manner of content that examines everything from how that incarnation of the Caped Crusader was developed to the creation of his Batmobile and gadgets. Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Walmart Superman Standard Editions $30 for 4K | $25 for Blu-ray | $21 for DVD While the 4K Steelbook Edition is the standout version, you can also preorder a standard edition of the movie on 4K UHD, Blu-ray, or DVD. The finalized cover art for these versions has not been revealed, and like the Steelbook Edition, we don't yet know what bonus features will be included. Nevertheless, preorders are available now at Amazon. Preorder 4K Preorder Blu-ray Preorder DVD Superman 4K Steelbook Edition Blu-ray Superman: The Art and Making of the Film $50 | Releases November 18 A Blu-ray for Superman isn't the only piece of tie-in content on the way, as you can read up on the movie with the upcoming Superman: The Art and Making of the Film art book launching November 18. This 176-page hardcover book features concept art, costume and character designs, and illustrations for the multiple locations featured in the movie, along with interviews with director James Gunn and other key members of the creative team, as well as a foreword written by Superman actor David Corenswet.Preorders are available now for $50 Preorder at Amazon Superman Prime Day DealsAt the time of writing, several Superman Blu-rays and graphic novels are still on special for Prime Day. There's a good chance that these might no longer be available at the prices listed below by the time you read this, but if you are looking to plug any gaps in your Superman collection, there's no shortage of options here.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Samsung's Flagship Galaxy Tablets & Earbuds Are On Sale For New Low Prices
description: Prime Day wraps up today, and if you're still looking to score a deal on some hardware, then you might want to see what Samsung has to offer. Amazon has discounted a bunch of Samsung Galaxy tablets and several pairs of Bluetooth earbuds, including a nearly 50% discount on the Samsung Galaxy Buds FE and $100 off Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI Bluetooth Earbuds. See all Samsung deals at Amazon The Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI normally cost $250, but you can snag a pair for $149.72. It's worth noting that Apple's AirPods Pro 2, which also normally sell for $249, are discounted to $149 alongside best-ever deals on both models of AirPods 4, Apple's newest Bluetooth earbuds.Continue Reading at GameSpot

author: Samantha Nelson

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 885
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Do you keep backups of your favorite products? These days, the only backups I buy are things I know I’ll finish on a regular basis (like shampoo and conditioner, or body lotion). I don’t even bother with makeup backups anymore, though. If I finish something like a blush or an eyebrow pencil, great, and if it’s still around when it’s time to restock, that’s even better. If it’s discontinued, I might mourn it a little bit, but there’s always something new coming out, and I don’t mind trying new things, so I don’t stress about it too much. 2. Something that you read/watched/listened to recently that was surprisingly great? I watched “KPop Demon Hunters” on Netflix with Connor over the weekend, and I was surprised to enjoy[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 885 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 884
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Do you have a favorite vegetable? Yes! Carrots, for sure. The fact that you can turn them into a cake is a big deal! I mean, come on, have you ever heard of a broccoli cake? Or an okra cake? Yeah, I didn’t think so, LOL! I also love that you can put them in salads, roast them or just eat them plain with a variety of different dips. 2. A song that’s been stuck in your head lately? “Top of the World” by The Carpenters has been on repeat in my car. 3. Something you’ve been avoiding lately? Social media and the news cycle in general. 4. Lip masks: yes or no? Yes, but only if we’re talking Laneige. 5. Whatcha reading right now? “The Mysterious[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 884 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Top city builder Against The Storm gets a grumpy bat faction and giant pooping birds in its next DLC this July
description: Bestest best roguelite city builder Against The Storm is getting invaded by bats. Not the kind that swoop and screech and dive around your car in New Games Journalism articles that lean a bit too obviously on Hunter S. Thompson - bless our hearts, we've all done it - but the kind who labour at the forge and rejoice when their colleagues crumble and may even drive other workers out in order to make themselves feel better. On the whole, I think I prefer the Fear and Loathing variety. Anyway, here's the trailer for Against the Storm's second DLC expansion, Nightwatchers, which will release on PC via Steam, GOG, Epic Games Store and the Microsoft Store on July 31st. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Sea of Thieves is getting paid custom servers next year, and Rare are switching up their approach to seasons
description: Big piratey thing Sea of Thieves will be getting custom servers as part of a paid subscription service in "early 2026", developers Rare have announced during a first-ever community direct for the game. That's far from all of the studio's plans, with wider shakeups also in the pipeline. This outlining of plans to make sure the good ship SOT is not only seaworthy, but can successfully broadside the many other vessels competing for its players' attention comes with some depressing and un-piratey context. It follows Rare being one of the studios affected by Microsoft's mass layoffs earlier this month, with Everwild being among the number of in-development games cancelled as part of the cuts. Read more
author: Mark Warren
